p: The roots of Piper sylvaticum are applied in the Ayurvedic system of Indian medicine to treat bronchitis, diseases of the spleen, and tumors, and also for for their laxative, anthelmintic, and carminative properties [ 120]. Chahal et al. [ 115] also cited that the roots of P. sylvaticum are widely used in Ayurvedic medicine as an effective antidote to snake poison.
